title: Xênia's French Fancy: Family Fun in Paris

objectsList.description: Packing lightly with about a week's worth of clothes that can be mixed and matched would be the best choice. It's best to take into consideration the hot summers in Paris and opt for lightweight, comfortable clothing.
Walking will be a major part of your sightseeing in Paris. Therefore, it's essential to have comfortable footwear that won't let you down.
Evenings in Paris can be cool, so bring a comfortable and light jacket.
Occasional showers can occur in Paris, therefore packing a rain jacket wouldn't hurt.
Hotels often have pools and it's an ideal way for family down-time.
Protect your eyes from the summer sun with a pair of good Sunglasses.
France and Brazil have different plug types and voltages, hence you need to pack a power adapter that would be suitable.
Don't miss out on capturing the golden moments of your trip. If you're heavy on mobile photography, don't forget your portable charger.
A lightweight daypack will be handy for carrying essential items during your day trips.
With hot summer temperature, staying hydrated is critical.

description: Xênia and her family are about to embark on an unforgettable journey to the heart of France, the city of love, Paris. They look forward to immersing themselves in a mix of history, art, spectacular cuisine, and unforgettable sights. From the iconic Eiffel Tower, beautiful parks, to child-friendly galleries and museums, Xênia and her family are ready for a true Parisian experience. The city is a perfect palette of memorable experiences waiting to be explored by Xênia and her family, with diverse options tailored to their interest in nature, sightseeing, and kid's activities.
tour: Start your tour with a visit to the iconic Eiffel Tower, Paris' defining landmark. Whether you ascend to the top or admire it from the ground, this marvel of engineering is a sight to behold. For a complete experience, consider having a French meal at one of the tower's fantastic restaurants. It's an ideal visit for families as children will be delighted with the spectacular views of the city and the thrill of being so high up.

The second day could be devoted to the exploration of the Louvre, the world's most voluminous art museum, and a historic landmark in Paris. The museum is home to a multitude of works from different cultural fields and historical periods, including the revered Mona Lisa. You can delight your children with the Egyptian art section, which includes mummies and fascinating ancient artifacts.

Take the family to enjoy the beauty of nature at the Jardin du Luxembourg, the city's much-loved Luxemborg Gardens, a stunning green space perfect for relaxing, picnicking or letting the kids enjoy the park's playgrounds, vintage carousel, or puppet shows. Additionally, you may try the delightful boat rentals in the Grand Bassin. The tranquil setting of the park makes it a fantastic family destination.
